events.title: Victory at the Siege of Belgrade
events.description: John Hunyadi, a Hungarian general, successfully defends Belgrade against the Ottoman Empire, halting their advance into Europe.
events.significance: Marked a significant Christian victory and delayed Ottoman expansion into Europe.

events.title: United States Annexes Hawaii
events.description: The United States formally annexes the Hawaiian Islands after overthrowing the monarchy, incorporating them into its territories.
events.significance: Expanded U.S. influence in the Pacific and set the stage for Hawaii's eventual statehood.

events.title: Sliced Bread First Sold
events.description: The first commercially sliced bread is sold by the Chillicothe Baking Company in Missouri, revolutionizing the baking and food industry.
events.significance: Sliced bread became a staple, making bread more convenient and influencing consumer habits.

events.title: 7/7 London Bombings
events.description: Coordinated suicide bomb attacks target London's public transport system during the morning rush hour, killing 52 and injuring hundreds.
events.significance: A major terrorist attack in the UK that influenced counterterrorism policies worldwide.
